sentences.sContent: There is also a golf course five miles away.
sentences.sCn: 五英里外还有个高尔夫球场。

sentences.sContent: I’ll be back by five (= five o’clock ) .
The family moved to Canada when he was five (= five years old ) .
sentences.sCn: 他五岁时全家移居加拿大。

sentences.sContent: ...Moses spent three hours looking after the bees and was stung five times...
...Leah reflects on a time she listened to the whispers: “About the time my daughter was five years old...
...almost three in five people say they try to limit their usage of paper—including facial tissue and kitchen roll―to save money...
...Product transitions used to take five or seven years; now they take one or two...

...The company spent the last five years developing solar panels that are only about a quarter of inch thick and are strong enough to stand up to heavy highway traffic without breaking or making the roads more slippery...
...France announced that the country will pave 621 miles of road with solar panels over the next five years with the goal of providing cheap...
...it takes four to five years after economic recovery for unemployment to return to pre-crisis levels...
...and then lists five regulations that the researchers think might be pronfising if applied tojunk foods...
...Each member volunteered to clean up and to dig and plant five flats of flowers...

phrases.pCn: 五百分（牌戏，一种以得500分为胜局的游戏）
n. 五官感觉（指视、听、触、嗅、味五种感觉）
击掌，表示庆祝胜利，加油

words.tran: 五件东西；五个人一组；有五人参加的游戏
